page.title: 03Buildings,Wishford area.
page.content: There has been little new building in the area,though there are small estates of council houses in Stapleford and Wishford.Most houses are old,and privately owned. {Notable buildings in Wishford.} The Almshouses,stone and flint,built in 1628.The school built in 1722.The oldest house in Wishford is probably Yew Tree cottage.Wishford Farm House was built in Tudor times,and altered in the Georgian era.Old Station House is all that is left of the Great Western Railway Station. Wishford House,at the top of the hill,was built in Georgian times. Chequer cottage is so called because the walls are made of squares of stone and flint.The old Rectory,opposite the Church,was built in Tudor times,but a Georgian front was added.
